result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad M. Scrivner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
1 day credit if revoked.
Concurrent with: with 16CF162.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall receive Alcohol and other Drug assessment from a licensed agency as determined by Probation Agent and follow any treatment recommendations.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

C: Defendant, DOC

Defendant Chad M. Scrivner in court with attorney Genelle M. Johnson.  
Veronica Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form filed with the Court. 
Court amends Count 1 in 16CF162 to Misdemeanor Battery 940.19(1) on motion of the State. 
Defendant questioned and advised of rights. 
Defendant enters no contest plea to amended Count 1 in 16CF162 and Count 2 in 15CM37. 
Court accepts pleas entered and finds guilty of each count. 
All remaining counts are ordered dismissed and read in. 
Restitution order filed with the Court. 
Sentence withheld, ordered 1 year Probation, concurrent on each count. 
Conditions: 
- pay costs 
- pay $3278.96 restitution and surcharge in 16CF162 
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by recommendations 
- submit to AODA assessment and abide by recommendations 
1 day credit if revoked. 
Advised of appeal rights. 
$1,000 bond in 15CM37 is to be applied to restitution in 16CF162.
